META_DOCUMENTATION.description: Implementation plan for hosting UDS documentation library on Vercel

available: README.md - Main project overview with structure and navigation
INDEX.md - Complete alphabetical index of all files
missing: API.md - API documentation (not applicable for static docs)
foundation_docs.impact: Sufficient documentation exists for MVP deployment. Missing docs are not critical for static hosting.

missing: No coding standards needed - this is a static documentation hosting project
coding_standards.impact: Not applicable for static site deployment

reference_components.note: No existing code components. This is a greenfield static site deployment using Vercel and a markdown renderer framework.

proposed.framework: Next.js with next-mdx-remote or similar markdown renderer

project_structure.internal_linking: Multiple cross-references between markdown files using relative paths

discovery_notes.file_count: 58 markdown files (context mentioned 49, actual count is 58)
discovery_notes.mobile_issue: GitHub mobile shows markdown files as empty - primary motivation for hosting solution

1_executive_summary.one_sentence_summary: Deploy the UDS documentation library (58 markdown files) to Vercel with auto-deployment to enable mobile-friendly viewing.
1_executive_summary.problem_statement: The UDS documentation library contains 58 critical markdown files across 6 categories, but these files appear empty when viewed on GitHub mobile, making the documentation inaccessible to mobile users.
1_executive_summary.proposed_solution: Create a minimal Next.js application that renders markdown files, deploy it to Vercel with auto-deployment configured, and ensure all internal links work correctly.
primary_benefits: Mobile accessibility - All 58 markdown files viewable on mobile devices
Auto-deployment - Changes pushed to GitHub automatically deploy to Vercel
Working links - Internal markdown cross-references function correctly
Simple maintenance - Minimal codebase with no complex features to maintain
Fast access - Vercel CDN provides global fast loading

in_scope: Internal link resolution between markdown files

1_executive_summary.estimated_effort: 1-2 days for MVP implementation and deployment
1_executive_summary.complexity_level: Low - Using well-established frameworks and hosting platform

2_risk_assessment.complexity_justification: Low complexity: Static site deployment using mature tools (Next.js, Vercel). Primary challenges are configuration and link resolution, not complex logic.

risks.description: Internal markdown links may break during conversion
mitigation: Test all internal links after deployment
Create a link map of all markdown cross-references
Use next-mdx-remote or similar that preserves relative links
Implement custom link transformer if needed
risks.contingency: Manual link correction and redirect rules in vercel.json

risks.description: Vercel build may fail due to large number of markdown files
mitigation: Use static generation with getStaticPaths for all markdown routes
risks.contingency: Switch to incremental static regeneration (ISR) or client-side rendering for some routes

risks.description: Some markdown files reference non-existent test files
mitigation: Ensure broken links don't crash the site
risks.contingency: Create placeholder pages for commonly referenced missing files

risks.description: Navigation may be unclear without sidebar
mitigation: Use INDEX.md and category README.md files as navigation
Ensure README.md is prominent as entry point
risks.contingency: Add breadcrumb navigation if users report confusion

dependencies.description: GitHub repository must be accessible to Vercel
